review: I give Chromecast 3 stars because the set-up process was pain in my neck. It should not take 40 min and four or five attempts to complete the setup. I started the process of setting up with my Galaxy S5 smartphone, but the WiFi would keep switching between the router and the device, cancelling the process in the middle. I finally had enough and used my Windows laptop and Google Chrome browser (with Google Cast extension) to complete the process. It involved a few additional steps, but eventually I was able to finish it. Once finished, It works fine, but still better off with Windows/Chrome that with Samsung phone.

author: Jennifer

review: This is what TV streaming should be! I love the Chromecast. Vudu works way more consistently on the Chromecast than it does on my Roku Stick, so I find myself using the Chromecast more often.The only thing I wish it had was a way to browse for shows and movies directly on the TV with a controller, or using gestures on an Android device. I know that's not the point of the Chromecast, but I don't think it would be that hard to add that type of interface, and would complete with Apple TV and Roku to a higher degree. It's not a BAD experience to use your phone to find your shows, it just takes some getting used to. I love the Chromecast either way.
